Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  Controller

public class Controller
extends Object

The Controller class is a utility class which stores all of the coordinates, and it will check and act as a Location class.

Version:
1.0.0.0 Last edited: June 3, 2014 Time spent: 5 hours
Author:
Horatiu Lazu

getXChange

public static int getXChange(int direction)
This method will get the X change for a particular direction. The if statements will return the appopriate files.

Parameters:
int - direction Stores the direction.
Returns:
int The new xChange.

int The new y change.

getChemicalDepth

public static int getChemicalDepth(int x,
                                   int y)
This method finds the depth of the chemical field, meaning the amount of chemicals and available spots within the three dimensional World based chemical array.

Parameters:
x - int This is the x coordinate of the chemical.
y - int This is the y coordinate of the chemical.
i - int This is a for loop variable.
Returns:
int The chemical depth. The for loop goes through the options until a null is presented. If no nulls are found, then the MAX_DEPTH from World is returned.

getPipeEntrance

public static int getPipeEntrance(int direction)
This method will find the neccessary pipe entrance depending based off of the exit point.

Parameters:
direction - int This is the direction. All of the if statements will find the opposite direction.
Returns:
int The pipe entrance.

getPipeExit

public static int getPipeExit(String fileName2,
                              int entrance,
                              boolean isDiagonal)
This method will find the pipe exit for the new pipe depending on the entrance point WITHIN the pipe itself!

Parameters:
fileName2 - String This is the filename for the pipe (used in the identification of the pipe type).
fileName2 - String This is the filename for the pipe (used in the identification of the pipe type).
entrance - int This is the entrance of the pipe.
isDiagonal - boolean This is the boolean if the pipe is on a diagonal.
Returns:
int The pipe exit. All of the if statements go through every possible type of pipe, and then return accordingly.

getDirectionForEntrance

public static int getDirectionForEntrance(String fileName2,
                                          int entrance,
                                          boolean isDiagonal)
This method essentially identifies the direction for the entrance based off of the previous point.

Parameters:
fileName - String This is the filename for the type of pipe.
entrance - int This is the entrance to the the type of pipe.
isDiagonal - boolean This indicates if the path is from a diagonal or not.
Returns:
int The direction for the entrance. All of the if statements verify for the different possibilities.
